function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Study of droplet physics and chemistry may lead to understanding the behavior of contagions in the built environment.","Impact":"Without proper understanding, the spread of contagious diseases in the built environment may be more difficult to control.","Mitigation":"Conduct further research and studies to understand the behavior of droplets containing contagions.","Technologies":"Advanced imaging techniques, computational modeling, and laboratory experiments can be used to study the behavior of droplets containing contagions.","People":"Researchers, epidemiologists, public health officials, and building management personnel.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, and building management authorities."},{"Description":"Equilibrium size of respiratory droplets may affect the spread of contagious diseases in indoor environments.","Impact":"Failure to account for droplet size and behavior may lead to inadequate measures to prevent the spread of contagious diseases in indoor spaces.","Mitigation":"Develop guidelines and standards for indoor spaces based on the knowledge of equilibrium droplet size and behavior.","Technologies":"Particle sizing instruments, microscopy, and computational modeling can be used to study the equilibrium size and behavior of respiratory droplets.","People":"Public health officials, building management personnel, and architects/designers of indoor spaces.","Owner":"Public health organizations, building management authorities, and regulatory agencies."},{"Description":"Impact of relative humidity (RH) on droplet size may influence the transmission of contagious diseases in the built environment.","Impact":"Inadequate control of indoor RH levels may lead to conditions that favor the survival and transmission of contagions in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Implement humidity control measures in indoor spaces to maintain RH levels that discourage droplet survival.","Technologies":"HVAC systems, dehumidifiers, and humidity sensors can be used to control and monitor indoor RH levels.","People":"Building management personnel, HVAC technicians, and public health officials.","Owner":"Building management authorities, HVAC service providers, and public health organizations."}]}
